item.title: Coronavirus: Rishi Sunak to unveil 'kickstart jobs scheme' for young people
item.description: The £2bn pledge for the young unemployed will be part of the chancellor's proposals outlined on Wednesday.

item.title: FBI director: China is 'greatest threat' to US
item.description: China is working be the world's superpower "by any means necessary," Christopher Wray said.

item.title: 'I was terrified to put on weight' - the 'culture of fear' in British gymnastics
item.description: In a special investigation, several gymnasts tell BBC Sport of an alleged "culture of fear" in the sport of weight shaming and abuse.

item.title: Coronavirus: Trump moves to pull US out of World Health Organization
item.description: The president follows up his vow to leave the world health body by formally notifying the UN.

item.title: Coronavirus: Brazil's President Bolsonaro tests positive
item.description: The president, who has belittled the risks posed by the virus, took the test after developing symptoms.

item.title: Coronavirus: Care workers reunited with families after 12 weeks
item.description: Meet the care workers who opted to live in their care home to protect the residents from Covid-19.

item.title: Coronavirus: Airborne transmission cannot be ruled out, WHO says
item.description: The WHO has acknowledged there is evidence that Covid-19 can be spread by airborne particles.

item.title: TikTok algorithm promoted 'sickening' anti-Semitic meme
item.description: Nearly 100 videos of an offensive song were viewed more than 6m times before TikTok took action.

item.title: 'Home-schooling has been hell'
item.description: Some parents have been reduced to tears over the strain of home-schooling, say campaigners.

item.title: Robust plan for PPE 'must be in place for winter'
item.description: There must be no shortages in protective gear if the UK faces a second wave of coronavirus, say MPs.

item.title: New government unit to take over Covid response
item.description: There are questions over whether the Joint Biosecurity Centre has the expertise needed for the job.

item.title: Boohoo dropped by Next, Asos and Zalando over exploitation claims
item.description: Three major online retailers have dropped Boohoo over allegations of low pay and unsafe conditions.

item.title: Six arrested after 'Dutch torture chambers' found
item.description: The suspects were located following the hack of a Europe-wide phone system.

item.title: Newspaper headlines: Sunak's £2bn jobs fund and 'shock' Depp claims
item.description: Coronavirus crisis support for young people and the Hollywood star's libel trial lead the papers.

item.title: How a Birmingham high street has been changed by coronavirus
item.description: Many of the independent businesses in a Birmingham suburb aren't sure when they will open again.

item.title: Camilla and Dame Judi on TikTok and learning new lockdown skills
item.description: The Duchess of Cornwall and Dame Judi Dench tell 5 Live neither of them had really liked being online before.

item.title: South Korea drone display says 'thanks' to key workers
item.description: The light show in South Korea also reminded people to wash their hands.

item.title: Boy's photos of Hull's empty streets 'capture lockdown moment'
item.description: Callum Utley, 15, wanted to capture the "empty eeriness" of Hull in lockdown.

item.title: NFL star signs record 10-year £400m contract extension
item.description: NFL star Patrick Mahomes signs a 10-year contract with the Kansas City Chiefs reported to be worth a record $503m (£403m).

item.title: Pub manager: 'We contacted every one of our customers'
item.description: A pub manager describes how her business handled the news that a customer had tested positive for coronavirus.

item.title: Nigel Slater's Toast returns in digital production
item.description: It has been a TV film, a play and now the chef's memoir has been adapted to help a local theatre.

item.title: Royal Mail trials refitted black cab electric vans
item.description: The project will start in Birmingham and gradually extend to other areas of the country.

item.title: Rishi Sunak's summer statement: Five things he may do
item.description: Here are five things to look out for in the chancellor’s summer update on Wednesday.

item.title: Amazon's Jeff Bezos: The richest person in the world
item.description: His wealth is now estimated to be $171bn (£137bn), having made billions during the pandemic.

item.title: Ringo Starr to celebrate 80th milestone with music friends
item.description: The Beatles drummer says he has no plans to slow down and looks forward to touring again.

item.title: ‘They paused my chemo because of Covid’
item.description: Thousands of cancer patients have had treatment halted or delayed because of Covid-19.

item.title: Black, disabled and female: 'I was told racism doesn't exist in 2020'
item.description: GB Paralympians Kare Adenegan and Kadeena Cox discuss the struggles they face as black athletes.

item.title: Newspaper headlines: China's warning to UK and 'naughty Tory' on trial
item.description: The front pages feature tensions between the UK and China and an ex-MP on trial for sexual assault.

item.title: The spying game: China's global network
item.description: The latest controversy around Huawei has shone a spotlight on the murky world of Chinese espionage.

item.title: Cumberlege review: The patients who fought for answers
item.description: The way patients' concerns over side effects were dealt with is addressed in a long-awaited review.

item.title: England v West Indies: Ben Stokes ready for 'massive occasion'
item.description: Stand-in captain Ben Stokes says England are ready for the "massive occasion" of the first Test against West Indies, which starts on Wednesday.

item.title: 'Rishi Sunak, we need help with rent, money and jobs'
item.description: Under-30s have been hardest hit by the lockdown, what do they want from the chancellor's summer update?

item.title: Racism and statues: How the toxic legacy of empire still affects us
item.description: BBC News presenter Clive Myrie says racism was the rocket fuel that fuelled British conquest of much of the planet - and its effects are still felt today.

item.title: TikTok: Chinese app may be banned in US, says Pompeo
item.description: US Secretary of State hints that Chinese apps - like TikTok - could be targeted.

item.title: How would a stamp duty holiday work?
item.description: The government is likely to announce changes to stamp duty to help cut costs for anyone buying a home.

item.title: Workers not eligible for furlough: 'It's been very stressful'
item.description: Workers are missing out on furlough because of their employment terms, and many are on minimum wage.

item.title: Coronavirus: Thousands say debilitating symptoms last 'for weeks'
item.description: Thousands of people with Covid-19 report recurring symptoms for far longer than 14 days.

item.title: 'Horrible' offices look to tempt back workers
item.description: Landlords are hoping cleaner, more convenient and more intelligent offices will tempt back workers.

item.title: Coronavirus: How fast is it spreading in Africa?
item.description: There are fears that the number of cases is growing rapidly, so what are the key trends?

item.title: Coronavirus: Disease detectives track an invisible culprit
item.description: They're working frantically to stop the pandemic spreading. And sometimes that means some awkward conversations.

item.title: What are my rights if I'm stopped and searched?
item.description: What is the controversial tactic which has led a Team GB athlete to consider legal action?

item.title: How have the arts reacted to cash injection?
item.description: The arts sector is relieved at the £1.57bn cash injection but says more detail is needed.

item.title: Vardy's late goal salvages draw for Leicester against 10-man Arsenal
item.description: Jamie Vardy equalises with five minutes remaining to earn Leicester a point at 10-man Arsenal.

item.title: Chelsea edge out Palace in five-goal thriller
item.description: Chelsea further strengthen their position in the Premier League's top four with victory over Crystal Palace at Selhurst Park.

item.title: Alonso set to return to F1 with Renault in 2021
item.description: Spanish two-time world champion Fernando Alonso is set to return to Formula 1 with Renault next year.

item.title: Superb Welbeck goal gives Watford vital win and leaves Norwich one loss from drop
item.description: Danny Welbeck's spectacular overhead kick winner helps Watford beat Norwich and move four points clear of the relegation zone.

item.title: Gossip - Juventus and Man City lead way in Traore chase
item.description: Man City and Juventus want Adama Traore, Barcelona keen on part-exchange for Tottenham duo, clubs put off by Havertz fee, plus more.

item.title: Metropolitan Police refers itself to watchdog over Williams stop-and-search
item.description: Footage of Bianca Williams and her partner being searched by officers has sparked controversy.

item.title: Coronavirus: What guidance did care homes get from the government?
item.description: Boris Johnson says "too many care homes didn't really follow the procedures", so what was the coronavirus guidance given to them?

item.title: What tests are being done in the UK?
item.description: What are the tests for coronavirus, who are they for and how do they work?

item.title: Who should be shielding?
item.description: People at risk of becoming severely ill if they get coronavirus should take extra precautions.

item.title: Coronavirus bubbles: How do they work and who is in yours?
item.description: Some people in England, Northern Ireland and Scotland can form "support bubbles".

item.title: Coronavirus: What are the UK's travel rules and which countries can you visit?
item.description: New agreements mean people entering the UK from certain countries will not have to quarantine.

item.title: How many confirmed cases in your area?
item.description: Key graphics explaining how coronavirus has spread in the UK and the government's response.

item.title: Coronavirus lockdown: Eight ways the lockdown has changed the UK
item.description: After three months of the restrictions, many aspects of everyday life have been transformed.

item.title: Coronavirus cure: What progress are we making on treatments?
item.description: Teams around the world are looking into medicines for Covid-19 and scientists are starting to discover what works.

item.title: Coronavirus pandemic: Tracking the global outbreak
item.description: Key maps and charts explaining how the respiratory virus has spread around the world and how it is being dealt with.

item.title: Coronavirus: Who should wear a face mask or face covering?
item.description: Face coverings are compulsory on public transport in England and Scotland.

item.title: Coronavirus: Where can I now go on holiday in the UK?
item.description: Where can I go and what can do on a holiday in the UK?

item.title: Coronavirus lockdown: All you need to know about new measures
item.description: How will social and work life be different after the easing of more restrictions?

item.title: Coronavirus: What are the changes to places of worship?
item.description: Churches, mosques and other places of worship have reopened in England - but with changes.

item.title: Coronavirus: How does contact tracing work?
item.description: People who have been in close contact with someone found to have Covid-19 are now being traced.

item.title: Coronavirus: What are the new rules when pubs reopen?
item.description: Pubs and restaurants in England can now reopen, but do I need to book ahead?

item.title: Coronavirus: What are social distancing and lockdown rules?
item.description: Social distancing and lockdown rules are changing in England - but what can you now do?

item.title: Lockdown rules: How to keep your guests safe from Covid-19
item.description: How to keep your guests safe when they come round to visit during a global pandemic?

item.title: Coronavirus: When will schools reopen?
item.description: Which children are going back to school, and what about the rest?

item.title: Leicester coronavirus outbreak timeline: Who knew what, and when?
item.description: By piecing together statements and claims, we have created a chronology of events.

item.title: Coronavirus: What's behind alarming new US outbreaks?
item.description: Cases are rising in Texas, Florida, Arizona and California - here's a look at the data and the theories.

item.title: Local lockdowns: Misleading claims circulate online
item.description: Local councils counter online rumours about imminent lockdowns, and what's behind them.

item.title: Coronavirus: How will local lockdowns work?
item.description: A local lockdown has been introduced to stop the spread of Covid-19 in Leicester - but how will it work?

item.title: Coronavirus: What are the UK travel quarantine rules?
item.description: What do you need to know if you're planning to fly during the Covid-19 pandemic?

item.title: Coronavirus: What does it mean if I've been furloughed by work?
item.description: Nine million people have accessed the scheme, which now allows furloughed workers to come back part-time.

item.title: Coronavirus: What are Leicester's new lockdown restrictions?
item.description: The city is the first to experience a local lockdown as officials try to curb its coronavirus cases.

item.title: Coronavirus: A visual guide to the economic impact
item.description: Key maps and charts explain how the virus has impacted markets and businesses around the world.

item.title: Can we holiday with another family? And other questions
item.description: Questions about support bubbles, and other coronavirus topics.

item.title: Coronavirus: Has China or the US tested more?
item.description: China and the US both say they have done the most testing for coronavirus - so who's right?

item.title: Where in the world are coronavirus cases rising and falling?
item.description: As the world hits the grim milestone of 10 million confirmed cases, which countries are seeing the biggest rises, and what might be behind them?

item.title: Coronavirus: What are the rules on weddings?
item.description: Many weddings were cancelled during lockdown, while some will have to change to meet the new rules.

item.title: Coronavirus: How long does it take to recover?
item.description: Recovery from Covid-19 can be a lengthy process, depending on how seriously people get the virus.

item.title: Coronavirus: Why surviving the virus may be just the beginning
item.description: For many survivors, waking up in intensive care was only the beginning of a long process of physical and psychological recovery.
